overview: This subject introduces graphic skills appropriate to design and building. These skills are taught through a series of constructed and freehand drawing assignments essential to the design thinking process. Graphic skills are developed through tutorials and lectures which are held in the studios and outdoors. Emphasis is given to the development of orthographic and perspective drawing, delineation and representation of form and volume.
ilo: Learn to draw and design with confidence
Demonstrate constructed, freehand and digital drawing techniques.
generic_skills: Perception of objects in a 3-dimensional framework
Presentation of projects verbally and graphically

Inherent requirements (core participatio.content: Further details on how to seek academic adjustments can be found on the Student Equity and Disability Support website:http://services.unimelb.edu.au/student-equity/home
